record.title: ORDERS FOR TUESDAY, MAY 8, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m., Tuesday, May 8; that on Tuesday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business for 60 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each, with the first half under the control of the majority and the second half under the control of the Republicans; that at the close of morning business, the Senate resume consideration of S. 1082; that on Tuesday, following the vote on the judicial nomination, the Senate stand in recess until 2:15 p.m., in order to accommodate the regular party conference

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
